meta.title: SITCON 2026 Sponsorship Prospectus - Support Open Source, Empower the Next Generation
meta.description: SITCON is a student-led community devoted to computing education and the promotion of open-source values. It is also a student-organized tech conference that gives students a stage to present and exchange ideas.

hero.title: Students need a stage, the industry needs talent
hero.title2: SITCON is the bridge where both meet
hero.subtitle: SITCON 2026 Students’ Information Technology Conference

intro.sentence1: SITCON is a student community dedicated to computing education and championing open-source culture.
intro.sentence2: It’s also a student-run conference that offers a stage for students to share and discuss technology.

cycle.title: More than a one-off collaboration
cycle.title2: It’s a cycle that can last ten or twenty years.

mobileCycleText.desc1: We host conferences and hackathons that give people from different fields a stage to showcase themselves and exchange knowledge.
mobileCycleText.desc2: We promote educational equity and industry–academia collaboration, cultivating organizational and leadership skills.
mobileCycleText.desc3: Find users and hire candidates—win the hearts of young developers.

cycle.slogan1: Joining SITCON isn’t just about exposure—it’s about becoming part of the community.
cycle.slogan2: From the first SITCON to your first project team, let your company start a new story with talent.

sdgs.desc1: SITCON offers tech talks, workshops, Hour of Code, and summer camps to help students explore computer science, improve digital literacy and innovation, and address rural education gaps—lowering barriers so everyone can learn.
sdgs.desc2: SITCON encourages exploration of emerging technologies, practical application of CS skills, and open-source sharing that contributes to infrastructure and innovation across industries.
sdgs.desc3: Our activities reach rural and resource-limited areas, encouraging participation and sharing. We provide equal opportunities for students from all backgrounds—through the community expo and café—so everyone enjoys fair chances to connect.
sdgs.desc4: Partnerships with the Ministry of Education, schools, and other communities are the foundation of our success. SITCON serves as a bridge connecting diverse resources to advance the SDGs.

time.location: Academia Sinica, Humanities and Social Sciences Building

R0.name: International Conference Hall
R0.description:
Total 426 seats
Opening and Keynote will take place here.

R1R2.name: First / Second Conference Room
R1R2.description: Each room has 112 seats; aisles and the back area can accommodate additional attendees.

R3.name: Teleconference Room
R3.description: Total 36 seats; additional standing space at both sides of the stage, in front of the first row, and at the back.

lounge.name: Lounge
lounge.description: A spacious, unobstructed open area with a wall of sunlit floor-to-ceiling windows. Unlike the lecture format in other rooms, this space supports flexible furniture layouts for various activities.

things.title: The largest student CS conference in East Asia
things.description: We inspired SITCON x HK and the Chongqing Student Open Source Conference, and we support student clubs and tech groups across regions. Each year, over half of our attendees are first-timers; alumni work across the tech industry in Taiwan, the U.S., Japan, and the Netherlands—and regularly return to give back.

things.title: Meetups across North, Central, and South Taiwan
things.description: We co-host meetups with local communities, offering students channels to exchange knowledge. We often collaborate with schools like National Taiwan University and Tamkang University, bringing together outstanding talents from everywhere.

things.title: SITCON Hour of Code
things.description: Since 2014, in partnership with the Ministry of Education, we’ve regularly hosted Hour of Code events across Taiwan, sparking curiosity for computing among hundreds of children aged 4–16.

things.title: SITCON Hackathon
things.description: We held HackGen in 2014 and 2015, and in 2024 we scaled up to the SITCON Hackathon. Participants learn to ideate, plan, and ultimately build—so society and industry discover high-potential student teams.

things.title: SITCON Summer Camp
things.description: Since 2014, every July we run a summer camp to help students get started with CS and ignite passion for open source. Students serve as both campers and volunteers. Beyond the core curriculum, we host open-source talks, a community expo, and the Vision Café—so learning is paired with rich opportunities to connect and exchange ideas.

plans.title: Choose the Plan That Fits You

items.title: Save Items of Interest
items.subtitle: Four tiers, some add-ons available. Mind the deadlines.
items.shareInterestedItemsText: You can share your items of interest with us via the form below

level_info.Beginner: Can follow book examples step by step to complete functions.
level_info.Novice: Understands examples and can modify them to solve problems.
level_info.Proficient: Can evaluate trade-offs among multiple solutions.
level_info.Advanced: Has rich experience and can advise others effectively.

inline: We want to give passionate students the resources, stage, and inspiration they deserve.
Yet for students, this is not easy.
SITCON stands where it is today thanks to supporters like you.

questions.question: Can we negotiate the price?
questions.answer: Our plan pricing is carefully calculated and already offers the best value. If you have specific needs or budget considerations, we’re happy to discuss.

questions.question: Can it be cheaper?
questions.answer: We understand your concern. While pricing is already quite reasonable, we can explore adjusting deliverables or other collaboration formats to fit your budget.

questions.question: Why is it so expensive?
questions.answer: The pricing reflects the event’s scale and impact. If it exceeds your budget, consider a lower tier or talk with us about a customized package.

questions.question: Do you offer discounts?
questions.answer: We offer early-bird and multi-year partnership discounts. First-time sponsors or those willing to sign multi-year agreements may receive corresponding offers. Please contact our sponsorship team for details.

footer.description: We welcome various forms of event or media collaboration—co-hosting workshops, hackathons, podcasts, and more. Reach out with your ideas.
